question.title: Will the ECDC weekly SARS-CoV-2 test positivity series show four consecutive week-over-week increases for the EU/EEA, before May 1, 2026?
question.description:
This forecasts whether European SARS-CoV-2 test positivity exhibits a sustained multi-week rise, which can signal accelerating transmission and pressure on health systems.

`{"format":"bot_tournament_question","info":{"hash_id":"f9ef3133013ffe25","sheet_id":189.1}}`
question.resolution_criteria: This question resolves Yes if, after the time the question opens and before May 1, 2026, the EU/EEA weekly SARS-CoV-2 test positivity values in the ECDC/ERVISS weekly dataset contain at least one run of four consecutive reporting weeks where each week’s positivity is strictly greater than the immediately prior week’s positivity. The primary source is the ECDC/ERVISS weekly data CSV “SARITestsDetectionsPositivity.csv” (EU-ECDC GitHub), which must be used to evaluate week labels and positivity values: [https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory\_viruses\_weekly\_data/refs/heads/main/data/SARITestsDetectionsPositivity.csv](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/SARITestsDetectionsPositivity.csv).
question.fine_print:
For purposes of this question, the first week being looked at is 2026-W06 and the final week is 2026-W17.

“Consecutive weeks” means consecutive reporting weeks in the dataset’s week field with no gaps. If multiple EU/EEA aggregates exist in the file, use the aggregate explicitly labeled for EU/EEA (or “EU/EEA total”) for SARS-CoV-2 positivity; if no EU/EEA aggregate exists, this question resolves No. If the primary file format changes, use the closest successor file in the same repository that clearly contains the same EU/EEA weekly SARS-CoV-2 positivity series; if no such successor is available by resolution time, resolve using the backup candidate source below. Candidate Sources (backup, used only if needed): ECDC ERVISS summary/links page: [https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/en/publications-data/european-respiratory-virus-surveillance-summary-erviss](https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/en/publications-data/european-respiratory-virus-surveillance-summary-erviss).
